title: Ticket #662: Create a SOAP-based command-line tool execution service
description:
Primarily to help out the BatLab w/ some collaborative work w/ ETICS, we need to create a daemonCore service that accepts a SOAP request, executes a command-line tool (in the specific case of ETICs, it will be nmi_submit), and then returns the results.

We are calling this service the condor_soapshell.

Some pithy documentation on the initial pass at this service exists here.

Some known deficiencies of this initial pass as of 8/12/09:

  • No user priv switching yet (!). Ideally it should switch UIDs based upon SSL authentication.
  • Doesn't take advantage of the procd for privledge separation support.
  • Doesn't take advantage of procfamily to clean up the entire process tree when a command complete.
  • It can only handle one request at a time. In other words, when a command is launched, the service will block until it completes. The difficulty arises because gsoap assumes a threaded model, not a daemoncore-style callback model.
  • No Win32 support --- currently just Unix/Linux only.
